bugs.title: CVE-2022-24834 redis: heap overflow in the lua cjson and cmsgpack libraries

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-24834 redis: heap overflow in the lua cjson and cmsgpack libraries

long_desc.thetext:
CVE-2022-24834 - A specially crafted Lua script executing in Redis can trigger a heap overflow in the cjson and cmsgpack libraries, and result in heap corruption and potentially remote code execution. The problem exists in all versions of Redis with Lua scripting support, starting from 2.6, and affects only authenticated and authorized users.

https://github.com/redis/redis/security/advisories/GHSA-p8x2-9v9q-c838

Created redis tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2222024]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2222025]

bugs.title: CVE-2023-36824 redis: heap overflow in COMMAND GETKEYS and ACL evaluation

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-36824 redis: heap overflow in COMMAND GETKEYS and ACL evaluation

long_desc.thetext:
CVE-2023-36824 - Extracting key names from a command and a list of arguments may, in some cases, trigger a heap overflow and result in reading random heap memory, heap corruption and potentially remote code execution. Specifically: using COMMAND GETKEYS* and validation of key names in ACL rules.

Affected versions >= 7.0.0

https://github.com/redis/redis/security/advisories/GHSA-4cfx-h9gq-xpx3

Created redis tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2222026]

This update's test gating status has been changed to 'ignored'.
This update has been pushed to testing.
This update has been submitted for stable by bodhi.
This update has been pushed to stable.

notes:
**Redis 7.0.12** -   Released Mon July 10 12:00:00 IDT 2023

Upgrade urgency SECURITY: See security fixes below.

Security Fixes:

*    (**CVE-2022-24834**) A specially crafted Lua script executing in Redis can trigger
    a heap overflow in the cjson and cmsgpack libraries, and result in heap
    corruption and potentially remote code execution. The problem exists in all
    versions of Redis with Lua scripting support, starting from 2.6, and affects
    only authenticated and authorized users.
*    (**CVE-2023-36824**) Extracting key names from a command and a list of arguments
    may, in some cases, trigger a heap overflow and result in reading random heap
    memory, heap corruption and potentially remote code execution. Specifically:
    using COMMAND GETKEYS* and validation of key names in ACL rules.

Bug Fixes

* Re-enable downscale rehashing while there is a fork child (#12276)
* Fix possible hang in HRANDFIELD, SRANDMEMBER, ZRANDMEMBER when used with `<count>` (#12276)
* Improve fairness issue in RANDOMKEY, HRANDFIELD, SRANDMEMBER, ZRANDMEMBER, SPOP, and eviction (#12276)
* Fix WAIT to be effective after a blocked module command being unblocked (#12220)
* Avoid unnecessary full sync after master restart in a rare case (#12088)
title: redis-7.0.12-1.fc37
